isis.stitle: International® DT 466E, DT 466, 530, 530E, and HT 530 Diesel Engines - Timing Gear Train and Front Cover - Remove - Idler Gear Assembly

note.para: Prior to removing any gear, mount Dial Indicator on engine and measure for gear backlash.

step1.para: Inspect gear train gears for nicks, chips, or wear. See "Inspect Idler Gear Assembly" in this section.
Rotate engine so timing marks on lower idler gear, upper idler gear, crankshaft gear, and camshaft gear are aligned.

note.para: Once aligned at "marks aligned" position, engine will require 34 crankshaft revolutions to return to "marks aligned" position again.

The following backlash measurements are more difficult to perform if cylinder head and valve train are assembled on engine. Additional force will be required to rotate camshaft back and forth to overcome valve spring force exerted on camshaft lobes.

step1.para: Mount magnetic base of Dial Indicator on top of crankcase.
Position Dial Indicator tip on upper idler gear tooth and zero Dial Indicator.
Place screwdriver between crankshaft and lower idler gear to prevent gear movement.
Rotate upper idler gear back and forth.
If backlash exceeds " Specification ," replace upper idler gear.
Position Dial Indicator tip on upper idler gear face and zero Dial Indicator. Measure upper idler gear end play.
Position Dial Indicator tip on lower idler gear tooth and zero Dial Indicator.
Place screwdriver between crankshaft and upper idler gear to prevent gear movement.
Move lower idler gear back and forth.
If backlash exceeds " Specification ," replace lower idler gear.
Position Dial Indicator tip on lower idler gear face and zero Dial Indicator. Measure lower idler gear end play.
Position Dial Indicator tip on camshaft gear tooth and zero Dial Indicator.
Place screwdriver between upper and lower idler gear to prevent gear movement.
Rotate camshaft gear back and forth.
If backlash exceeds " Specification ," replace camshaft gear.
Position Dial Indicator tip on camshaft gear face and zero Dial Indicator. Measure camshaft gear end play.

note.para: Before idler gear assembly removal, measure idler gear assembly backlash and end play.

step1.para: Loosen and remove lower idler gear retaining bolt. Remove idler gear assembly from front cover. Use Lower Idle Gear Socket (ZTSE4383) or equivalent.
Remove and discard upper idler gear retaining bolt. Remove upper idler gear.

note.para: New upper idler gear bolt must be used with each installation of upper idler gear. There is pre-applied sealant on new mounting bolt.
Each idler gear (upper and lower) is supported on tapered roller bearings and shafts. Bearings are not serviced separately. If bearing is worn or loose, replace complete gear assembly.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Camshaft Gear
svcsubproc.para: Remove cam gear or camshaft and gear as an assembly. See " Camshaft Gear and Camshaft " in the "Rocker Arm Assembly, Camshaft, Tappets, and Push Rods" section in this manual.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Crankshaft Gear
svcsubproc.para: Remove crankshaft and gears. See " Crankshaft and Main Bearings " in the "Vibration Damper, Crankshaft, Main Bearings, Flywheel, and Crankcase" section of this manual.
